data.prayer: Lord, make the 7,679 believers in Boké to be brave and clear with the gospel to their 1,075,422 neighbors.
data.verse: So Paul and Barnabas spent considerable time there, speaking boldly for the Lord, who confirmed the message of his grace by enabling them to perform signs and wonders.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Boké, Guinea
data.section_summary: What beauty can God be thanked for in this photo?

data.prayer: Spirit, encourage every believer in Boké, Guinea to do the work of an evangelist with their friends and neighbors.
data.verse: But you, keep your head in all situations, endure hardship, do the work of an evangelist

data.prayer: Father, see the suffering of your people in the state of Boké. Deliver all those who have not forgotten your Word.
data.verse: Look on my suffering and deliver me, for I have not forgotten your law.

data.prayer: Spirit, defend the church in the state of Boké against being inward-focused.
data.verse: The Spirit of the Sovereign LORD is on me, because the LORD has anointed me to proclaim good news to the poor. He has sent me to bind up the brokenhearted, to proclaim freedom for the captives and release from darkness for the prisoners.

data.prayer: Lord, remember the Baga Fore, Black Baga people. Make the Baga Fore, Black Baga people a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for your own possession.
Jesus, make yourself known to the 1,083,100 people living in Boké through the internet today.
data.verse: They have no speech, they use no words; no sound is heard from them. Yet their voice goes out into all the earth, their words to the ends of the world. In the heavens God has pitched a tent for the sun.

data.prayer: Spirit, how will they hear without a preacher? How will they preach unless they have a Bible? Please give the people in the state of Boké access to a Bible in their own language.
data.verse: How, then, can they call on the one they have not believed in? And how can they believe in the one of whom they have not heard? And how can they hear without someone preaching to them? And how can anyone preach unless they are sent? As it is written: “How beautiful are the feet of those who bring good news!”

data.prayer: Spirit, we know that cultures come and go, even in the state of Boké, but the truth of your Word endures generations.
data.verse: Your Word, Lord, is eternal; it stands firm in the heavens.

location.name: Boké
location.people_groups_list: Baga Koga, Deaf, Arab, Lebanese, Baga Binari, Mandenyi
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Baga Koga (5,000), Deaf (131,000), Arab, Lebanese (5,500), Baga Binari (3,800), Mandenyi (44,000)
